metadata.name: Potential Arbitrary Command Execution Via FTP.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects execution of "ftp.exe" script with the "-s" or "/s" flag and any child processes ran by "ftp.exe".

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\ftp.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\ftp.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('ftp.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-s:')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/s:')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('–s:')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('—s:')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('―s:')))))

output.summary: Detects execution of "ftp.exe" script with the "-s" or "/s" flag and any child processes ran by "ftp.exe".
